snippet: The Nigerian terrorist group appeared to make a spiritually binding oath to follow the authority of the Islamic State, but experts said the practical significance of the move was unclear.
abstract: Terrorism experts offer differing opinions on practical significance of public pledge of fidelity made by Nigerian terrorism group Boko Haram to authority of Islamic State; some say it is too early to predict whether Boko Haram's oath means group will aim its violent focus beyond Nigeria.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt and Adam Nossiter contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Nigerian terrorist group appeared to make a spiritually binding oath to follow the authority of the Islamic State, but experts said the practical significance of the move was unclear.

headline.main: Boko Haram Generates Uncertainty With Pledge of Allegiance to Islamic State
headline.print_headline: Boko Haram Generates Uncertainty With Pledge

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
